page.title: 10WW2 SECRET UNDERGROUND CITY
page.content: {Monkton Farleigh mine -World War 2 underground ammunition depot open to public.Signposted from A4 roundabout at Bathford 4 miles East of Bath. Constructed by the{British Army}for storage of ammunition needed to defeat fascist forces.Built by 7500 men it is an 80 acre labyrinth of tunnels and storage space. {Power House}hewn from rock 100 feet below the earth.Lights throw daylight effect over smooth floors. Series of huge{ventilating}fans,each twice the height of a man give air to mine. Illuminated by 25,000 electric lights. Arterial system of railways and conveyors carried ammunition from depot through a tunnel to{Main Line railway a mile or so away. 3{tours}per day for visitors and every 30 minutes at the weekend.
